title: Base Chain Documentation
description: Comprehensive documentation for Base Chain - Ethereum Layer 2 network built on OP Stack

whyBase.title: Why Base
whyBase.description: Key advantages and reasons to choose Base for blockchain development

technicalPerformance.cost: Transactions costing less than a cent

developerEcosystem.openSource: Extensive suite of open-source developer tools

whyBase.mission: Revive the spirit of innovation where two builders in a garage can create a massively successful business

deployOnBase.title: Deploy on Base
deployOnBase.description: Guide for deploying applications and smart contracts on Base

setupSteps.title: Set Up Development Environment
tasks: Create .env file with Base network RPC URLs

setupSteps.title: Configure Node Connection
tasks: Use Base Sepolia RPC URL for testing
Secure private key in Foundry's keystore

bestPractices: Leverage OnchainKit for seamless frontend connections
highlights: Ethereum L2 built to bring the next billion users onchain

connectingToBase.title: Connecting to Base
connectingToBase.description: Network configuration and connection methods for Base

coinbaseWallet.process: Select Base from network dropdown menu

metamask.process: Enter network details like RPC endpoint, chain ID, etc.

recommendations: For production systems, use node partners or run your own Base node
Rate-limited RPC endpoints are not recommended for production

bridgeToken.title: Bridge Token
bridgeToken.description: Process for bridging tokens to and from Base network
keySteps: Deploy your ERC-20 token on Base
Submit token details to Superchain token list
bridgeToken.bridgeFramework: Base recommends using their 'standard bridge' framework
requirements: Token contract must be compatible with standard bridge interface

approvalProcess.review: Token submissions are reviewed by the Base team
approvalProcess.checks: Base conducts preliminary checks but does not fully endorse listed tokens

bridgeToken.disclaimer: Base has conducted only preliminary checks and does not fully endorse tokens on the list

baseContracts.title: Base Contracts
baseContracts.description: Core contract addresses for Base network
baseContracts.note: Most L2 contract addresses remain consistent between mainnet and testnet

networkFees.title: Network Fees
networkFees.description: Fee structure and cost optimization for Base transactions

l2ExecutionFee.description: Cost to execute a transaction on Layer 2
characteristics: Adjusts dynamically similar to Ethereum's fee mechanism

l1SecurityFee.description: Cost to publish the transaction on Layer 1
characteristics: Typically higher than the L2 execution fee
Fluctuates depending on L1 transaction volume

optimizationStrategies: Submit transactions during periods of lower gas prices (e.g., weekends)
Monitor L1 and L2 transaction volumes
Refer to op-stack developer documentation for detailed fee calculations
networkFees.keyNote: Every Base transaction consists of two costs: an L2 (execution) fee and an L1 (security) fee

ecosystemContracts.title: Ecosystem Contracts
ecosystemContracts.description: DeFi and ecosystem contract addresses on Base
ecosystemContracts.testnetSupport: Similar structure to mainnet with different addresses
ecosystemContracts.coverage: Core infrastructure like multicall, routing, and token management for DEXs

blockBuilding.title: Block Building
blockBuilding.description: Block production and sequencing mechanisms on Base

flashblocks.description: Currently uses Flashblocks on Base Mainnet and Base Sepolia
flashblocks.frequency: Priority fee auctions occur every 200 milliseconds
characteristics: Once a Flashblock is built and broadcast, transaction ordering is locked
Later arriving transactions with higher fees cannot replace earlier transactions

gasLimitConsiderations.largeTransactions: Transactions over 1/10 of block gas limit face additional constraints
progressiveAllocation: Flashblock 1: Up to 1/10 of total gas
Flashblock 2: Up to 2/10 of total gas
Subsequent blocks: Continue increasing gas allocation

alternateConfiguration.description: Vanilla blocks built every 2 seconds using op-geth

changelog: July 7th: Enabled Flashblocks on Base Mainnet
February 25th: Enabled Flashblocks on Base Sepolia

diffsEthereumBase.title: Differences: Ethereum vs Base
diffsEthereumBase.description: Technical differences between Ethereum and Base networks
diffsEthereumBase.architecture: Built on Bedrock release of the OP Stack
diffsEthereumBase.designGoal: Designed to be as close to Ethereum as possible
diffsEthereumBase.compatibility: Maintains very close compatibility to Ethereum
diffsEthereumBase.developerExperience: Nearly identical development experience compared to Ethereum
diffsEthereumBase.reference: Check OP Stack Bedrock differences documentation for detailed technical specifics

apps.title: Flashblocks for Apps
apps.description: Ultra-fast blockchain confirmations for real-time applications
keyFeatures: Designed for real-time applications, games, and interactive experiences
Supports integration through RPC and WebSocket APIs
apps.purpose: Seamless, ultrafast and snappy user experiences without compromising security

nodeProviders.title: Flashblocks Node Providers
nodeProviders.description: Specialized RPC node functionality for Base Flashblocks
verification: Test node functionality by querying a pending block
Supports standard Ethereum JSON-RPC methods with additional Flashblocks endpoints
nodeProviders.uniqueFeature: Websocket API streams 'Flashblock' data with minimal block diff data to reduce transmission overhead
nodeProviders.implementation: Each Flashblock contains initial block properties or subsequent transaction/state changes
nodeProviders.documentation: Detailed technical implementation in Reth node README

runBaseNode.title: Run a Base Node
runBaseNode.description: Guide for operating Base blockchain nodes

prerequisites.warning: Running a node is time consuming, resource expensive, and potentially costly

hardwareRequirements.additionalStorage: Sufficient storage for chain data and snapshots

setupSteps: Obtain an Ethereum L1 full node RPC
Configure .env files for mainnet or testnet
Use Docker to run the node

snapshotOptions.availability: Snapshots available for Geth (Full) and Reth (Archive)

importantConsiderations: Recommended to use node provider partners for production
monitoring: Use CLI commands to check sync status
Verify node connectivity by testing RPC endpoints
runBaseNode.recommendation: For users with specific infrastructure needs who understand resource requirements and technical complexity

snapshots.title: Snapshots
snapshots.description: Node snapshot restoration and backup strategies
snapshots.benefits: Snapshots significantly reduce initial node sync time
restorationProcess: Prepare data directory matching Docker configuration
Download appropriate snapshot for network and client
Move extracted data to correct directory
Start node and verify sync progress
importantNotes: Geth Archive Nodes are no longer supported via snapshots due to performance limitations
Ensure sufficient disk space for download and extraction
postRestorationSteps: Verify sync from snapshot's block height
Delete downloaded snapshot archive to free disk space

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Common node issues and debugging solutions

troubleshootingSteps.title: Check Container Logs
troubleshootingSteps.method: Use docker compose logs -f <service_name> to view real-time logs
troubleshootingSteps.focus: Check logs for L2 Client (Geth/Reth) and Rollup Node

troubleshootingSteps.title: Verify Container Status
troubleshootingSteps.method: Run docker compose ps to confirm containers are running
troubleshootingSteps.focus: Look for frequent restarts or exited containers

troubleshootingSteps.title: Monitor System Resources
troubleshootingSteps.method: Check CPU, RAM, disk I/O, and network usage

setupConfiguration: Ensure correct JWT secret and authentication
Resolve permission issues with data volumes
syncingProblems: Verify L1 node health and sync status
performanceIssues: Consider using Reth for better performance

baseProducts.title: Base Products
baseProducts.description: Official Base tools and developer products

onchainKit.description: Ready-to-use, full-stack components to make building onchain faster and easier
onchainKit.features: Components for identity, transactions, wallet interactions, and more

miniKit.description: Build mini apps to increase your distribution and find traction

agentKit.description: A toolkit for building onchain AI agents

smartWallet.description: A single sign-on for the open internet. No app or extension required

appchains.description: Scale your app with a dedicated chain on Base

paymaster.description: Account Abstraction endpoints to send transactions and sponsor gas

baseProducts.designGoal: Simplify blockchain development, reduce complexity, and help developers build more efficiently on the Base ecosystem

onchainRegistryApi.title: Onchain Registry API
onchainRegistryApi.description: API for accessing Base's onchain registry of projects and applications

getFeatured.description: Returns a single actively featured entry

usageGuidelines: Filter entries using target_url and creator_name
onchainRegistryApi.licensing: Provided under Coinbase Developer Platform Terms of Service

nodeProviders.title: Node Providers
nodeProviders.description: Third-party node infrastructure services for Base

overview.networkSupport: Most support Base Mainnet and Base Sepolia Testnet

pricingModels: Tiered pricing with increased request limits
nodeProviders.selectionGuidance: Evaluate providers based on specific project requirements, rate limits, performance, and additional features

blockExplorers.title: Block Explorers
blockExplorers.description: Blockchain data exploration and analysis tools for Base

features: Shows people and companies behind blockchain activity
View and verify smart contract source code
Search by address, transaction hash, batch, or token
View and verify smart contract source code
Transaction, block, and account balance data

l2scan.description: Analyzes Base and other layer 2 networks

features: Address labels and real-time on-chain data
Searches transactions, addresses, tokens across Superchain blockchains
Supports Base mainnet and Base Sepolia

networkFaucets.title: Network Faucets
networkFaucets.description: Testnet token distribution services for Base development

coinbaseDeveloperPlatform.description: Provides free Base Sepolia testnet ETH
coinbaseDeveloperPlatform.limitation: Requests limited to one claim per 24 hours

thirdweb.description: Offers free Base Sepolia testnet ETH
thirdweb.feature: Allows developers to connect wallet through EOA or social logins

superchain.description: Provides testnet ETH for OP Chains including Base
superchain.benefit: Offers more tokens for developers with onchain identity

alchemy.limitation: Requests limited to one claim per 24 hours

networkFaucets.purpose: Obtain testnet ETH for developing and testing on Base network

oracles.title: Oracles
oracles.description: Data oracle providers and price feed services for Base

offerings: 200+ price feeds on Base Mainnet and Testnet
Requires LINK token for some services
Price feeds for crypto, stocks, FX, and metals
Pyth Entropy for random number generation
VRF and decentralized oracle price feeds

features: Most providers support both Base Mainnet and Base Sepolia Testnet
Services include price feeds, random number generation, and data integration
Varying levels of decentralization and data sourcing

onboarding.title: Onboarding
onboarding.description: User onboarding solutions and wallet integration tools

features: Login flows for crypto-native and non-native users
Compatible with EVM chains like Base
Authentication via email, phone, social profiles

dataIndexers.title: Data Indexers
dataIndexers.description: Blockchain data indexing and querying solutions

features: Near real-time Base data for infrastructure needs
Supports multiple destinations like Snowflake and BigQuery
Full archival copy of blockchain data
Unified API and Increment analytics platform
HyperSync for rapid historical data syncing
Indexing blockchain data through multiple indexers

crossChain.title: Cross-Chain

capabilities: Secure message and token transfers across blockchains
Access to users and liquidity on 30+ chains
Purchase NFTs using tokens from different chains

crossChain.documentation: Comprehensive documentation and GitHub examples available for each tool

accountAbstraction.title: Account Abstraction
accountAbstraction.description: Smart wallet and gasless transaction solutions

biconomy.description: Simplest UX for dapp or wallet

accountAbstraction.benefits: Create more user-friendly blockchain experiences, simplify wallet interactions, sponsor gas, and streamline transactions

onramps.title: Onramps
onramps.description: Fiat-to-crypto conversion and payment integration solutions

features: Covers 100+ cryptocurrencies, including ETH on Base
Payment gateway for fiat to crypto conversion

alchemyPay.description: Payment solutions provider connecting fiat and crypto economies

tokensInWallet.title: Tokens in Wallet
tokensInWallet.description: Token management and display in Coinbase Wallet
tokenIssuerSteps: Deploy ERC-20 token on Base Mainnet
List cryptocurrency on aggregators like CoinGecko or CoinMarketCap
displayFeatures: Tokens instantly available for swapping after contract deployment
Newly launched tokens with under $1M market cap appear in 'Newer tokens' section
additionalFeatures: Send via text feature for easy crypto sharing
Trending Swaps section showcasing top traded tokens
bestPractices: Use official social media to document logo/description changes
Submit updates with original contract deployment address
Communicate potential trading risks to community

keyFeatures: Ethereum Layer 2 built on OP Stack
Ultra-fast transaction speeds (1 second, 200ms with Flashblocks)
EVM compatibility with minimal differences from Ethereum
Extensive oracle and infrastructure provider support
Advanced account abstraction and smart wallet capabilities
Robust node infrastructure and block exploration tools
targetAudience: Blockchain developers building on Ethereum Layer 2
